content: the blo round 7 i work a decrease between the stitch we already worked in right before the pole and the next available st of the lantern to avoid gaps if you work it this way the decrease counts as the 1st st of the next bullet point round 8 i work invisible decreases throughout except when going over the poles then i switch to a normal decrease do what you re comfortable with staff i like to crochet most of it without the dowel but insert it to check the size every once in a while if the dowel doesn t fit after round 6 try going up or down hook sizes until it fits e pole pole l l e k i n y b e d work decrease work decrease a m here here d n a h round 7 help round 7 help lantern base next to anything = see tips and tricks page -start with lantern color round 1 8 single_crochet in magic_ring 8 round 2 8 increase 16 round 3 *single_crochet increase* x8 24 round 4 24 bpsc 24 -count your sts it can be easy to miss the last bpsc round 5 *4 single_crochet decrease* x4 20 round 6 *3 single_crochet decrease* x4 16 round 7 use tight gauge when working the last single_crochet of the pole and when working the next st of the lantern to avoid large gaps -the poles are worked between sts and do not count as sts 4 single_crochet pole chain 13 starting in 2nd chain from hook 12 single_crochet starting in next available st 8 single_crochet pole chain 13 starting in 2nd chain from hook 12 single_crochet starting in next available st 4 single_crochet 16 drop poles and ignore until round 17 handmade by nikelle lantern cont -make sure the poles are on the outside of your project and that you do not crochet into them when working round 8 count your sts round 8 2 decrease before pole 4 decrease between poles 2 decrease after pole 8 change to light color -stuff the base firmly but not too firmly if you want it to be able to stand on it s own round 9 blo 8 increase 16 -fo lantern color and tie knots with tails from the color change round 10-13 4 rnds 16 single_crochet 16 round 14 *2 single_crochet decrease* x4 12 change to lantern color round 15 12 loose slip_stitch 12 -fo light color and tie knots with tails from the color change round 16 blo of the slsts *2 single_crochet increase* x4 16 she s a she s a sassy gal sassy gal handmade by nikelle finished round 8 finished round 15 finished round 8 finished round 15 lantern cont -adjust round 17 as needed to place the top of the poles directly above the bottom of them -i recommend stuffing before working round 17 for the sake of alignment round 17 4 single_crochet 2 single_crochet through top of pole and lantern
